## Public Member Functions

### getNumMatches() {#ad5d348cc6c3aa2942d9ebeadef92863f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned Regex::getNumMatches () const">
getNumMatches - In a valid regex, return the number of parenthesized matches it contains.

The number filled in by match will include this many entries plus one for the whole regex (as element 0).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/regex-h/#l00072">72</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/regex-h">Regex.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regex-cpp/#l00079">79</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regex-cpp">Regex.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### match() {#ae787b71e8d775a2b662d04e913489d8d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool Regex::match (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> String, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> &gt; &#42; Matches=nullptr, std::string &#42; Error=nullptr) const</>}>
matches - Match the regex against a given <code>String</code>.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Matches">- If given, on a successful match this will be filled in with references to the matched group expressions (inside <code>String</code>), the first group is always the entire pattern.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="<a href=&quot;/docs/api/classes/llvm/error&quot;>Error</a>">- If non-null, any errors in the matching will be recorded as a non-empty string. If there is no error, it will be an empty string.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>
This returns true on a successful match.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/regex-h/#l00084">84</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/regex-h">Regex.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regex-cpp/#l00083">83</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regex-cpp">Regex.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### sub() {#a603517a82c194cc3daa912831dff244a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::string Regex::sub (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Repl, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> String, std::string &#42; Error=nullptr) const</>}>
sub - Return the result of replacing the first match of the regex in <code>String</code> with the <code>Repl</code> string.

Backreferences like &quot;\\0&quot; and &quot;\\g&lt;1&gt;&quot; in the replacement string are replaced with the appropriate match substring.

Note that the replacement string has backslash escaping performed on it. Invalid backreferences are ignored (replaced by empty strings).


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="<a href=&quot;/docs/api/classes/llvm/error&quot;>Error</a>">If non-null, any errors in the substitution (invalid backreferences, trailing backslashes) will be recorded as a non-empty string. If there is no error, it will be an empty string.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/regex-h/#l00098">98</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/regex-h">Regex.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regex-cpp/#l00137">137</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regex-cpp">Regex.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
